alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 11:45AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North near Hickson affecting Cass County. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. .Temperatures above freezing over the last several days is starting the snow melt. High temperatures over the next several days will range from the low 50s to the upper 60s in forested areas. This is expected to further ripen the snow pack and, with anticipated melting, will result in increased flows of water into the rivers resulting in rapid rises. There will be variations as to degree of snow melt depending on how high temperatures will get over the next several days. At this time, precipitation will be limited. However, if rainfall occurs later toward the weekend, it will have an impact on forecast rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buffalo River near Dilworth. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, The approach road on the north side of the bridge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Monday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning and continue rising to 22.0 feet Monday morning. However, the crest may vary between 21.0 feet and 23.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
